games.stumped

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • joueur.BaseGame
      • games.stumped.Game

  • public class Game
extends joueur.BaseGame
    Gather branches and build up your lodge as beavers fight to survive.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<Beaver> beavers
      Every Beaver in the game.
      Player currentPlayer
      The player whose turn it is currently.
      int currentTurn
      The current turn number, starting at 0 for the first player's turn.
      int freeBeaversCount
      When a Player has less Beavers than this number, then recruiting other Beavers is free.
      java.util.List<Job> jobs
      All the Jobs that Beavers can have in the game.
      double lodgeCostConstant
      Constant number used to calculate what it costs to spawn a new lodge.
      int lodgesToWin
      How many lodges must be owned by a Player at once to win the game.
      int mapHeight
      The number of Tiles in the map along the y (vertical) axis.
      int mapWidth
      The number of Tiles in the map along the x (horizontal) axis.
      int maxTurns
      The maximum number of turns before the game will automatically end.
      java.util.List<Player> players
      List of all the players in the game.
      java.lang.String session
      A unique identifier for the game instance that is being played.
      java.util.List<Spawner> spawner
      Every Spawner in the game.
      double spawnerHarvestConstant
      Constant number used to calculate how many branches/food Beavers harvest from Spawners.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> spawnerTypes
      All the types of Spawners in the game.
      java.util.List<Tile> tiles
      All the tiles in the map, stored in Row-major order.

        gameObjects, name

    • Field Detail

      • beavers

        public java.util.List<Beaver> beavers
        Every Beaver in the game.

      • currentPlayer

        public Player currentPlayer
        The player whose turn it is currently. That player can send commands. Other players cannot.

      • currentTurn

        public int currentTurn
        The current turn number, starting at 0 for the first player's turn.

      • freeBeaversCount

        public int freeBeaversCount
        When a Player has less Beavers than this number, then recruiting other Beavers is free.

      • jobs

        public java.util.List<Job> jobs
        All the Jobs that Beavers can have in the game.

      • lodgeCostConstant

        public double lodgeCostConstant
        Constant number used to calculate what it costs to spawn a new lodge.

      • lodgesToWin

        public int lodgesToWin
        How many lodges must be owned by a Player at once to win the game.

      • mapHeight

        public int mapHeight
        The number of Tiles in the map along the y (vertical) axis.

      • mapWidth

        public int mapWidth
        The number of Tiles in the map along the x (horizontal) axis.

      • maxTurns

        public int maxTurns
        The maximum number of turns before the game will automatically end.

      • players

        public java.util.List<Player> players
        List of all the players in the game.

      • session

        public java.lang.String session
        A unique identifier for the game instance that is being played.

      • spawner

        public java.util.List<Spawner> spawner
        Every Spawner in the game.

      • spawnerHarvestConstant

        public double spawnerHarvestConstant
        Constant number used to calculate how many branches/food Beavers harvest from Spawners.

      • spawnerTypes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> spawnerTypes
        All the types of Spawners in the game.

      • tiles

        public java.util.List<Tile> tiles
        All the tiles in the map, stored in Row-major order. Use `x + y * mapWidth` to access the correct index.

    • Method Detail

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Gets the Tile at a specified (x, y) position
        Parameters:
        x - integer between 0 and the mapWidth
        y - integer between 0 and the mapHeight
        Returns:
        the Tile at (x, y) or null if out of bounds
